intro: Mandevilla cereola, commonly known as the yellow mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth texture and can grow up to 10 inches in length. Mandevilla cereola is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in warm, sunny conditions.
